sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Annals of St Augustine's, Canterbury. Canterbury Documents, etc.
Annales S. Augustini Cantuar. Canterbury documents, etc.
msDesc.p: Vellum, 255 154 10.2 x 6, ff. 1 + 113, mostly about 44 lines to a page. Cent. xiv early, in charter hand.
From St Augustine's, Canterbury. At bottom of f. 1r is a slip pasted on: Liber ffratris Stephani de Hakynton de librario Sancti Augustini Cantuariensis. It is not in the Catalogue.
ff. a-b + i + 1-68 + 68a-d (68av-68br uncut and unphotographed) + 69-90 + 90a + 91-98 + 98a + 99-108 + ii + c-d.

msItem.ab: Chronicle
msItem.rubric: Ante incarnacionem domini mo cco venit Brutus in Angliam et regnauit xxiiiior annis cuius tempore judicauit Heli filios israel
msItem.incipit: Fluxit ab Enea primum Romana propago, etc.
msItem.rubric: Eneas cum Ascaneo filio suo fugiens excidium
msItem.ab: Added (xiv): Habet Britannia in longitudinem dccc milia et in latitudinem cc. Et quicunque (?) usui mortalium congruit indeficienti fertilitate ministrat
Ends p. 44 in 1200
msItem.rubric: Ipseque Rex ffrancorum Regem Johannem de prodicione appellauit
Quere de gestis Henrici filii Johannis in xio xiio xiiio et quartodecimo foliis
msItem.ab: (i.e. pp. 65 sqq.)
List of Kingdoms, Counties and Bishoprics in England
msItem.rubric: Incipit cronice paucorum scilicet ab incarnatione domini nostri Ihesu Christi
msItem.explicit: ab origine mundi usque ad Christum fluxerunt anni quinque milia centum nonaginta nouem
msItem.ab: The form is annalistic: at first in double columns down to 1038: one line for a year: from 1039 to 1186 a line to a year, single columns
Insertion on Archbishop Baldwin
1187-1226, a line to a year
Then longer entries
1235-1253, a line to a year. Then longer entries

There are various changes of hand after p. 113 (1304): on 136 (1315, Statute de venditionibus) is a xvith cent. reference: Vide in libro qui inscribitur Diuersi tractatus monasterii Sancti Augustini Dorobernie. This is a book mentioned in Parker's own list but marked therein as missing by John Parker: it is now Lambeth MS. 1213
The text goes to 1316 ending with Edward II's letter to Pope Clement on the election of an Abbot of St Augustine's (Devenysshe), ending p. 140
In another hand: the letter of the Barons on the same in French, ending imperfectly. The end is supplied in a xvith cent. hand on two out of four small leaves of paper inserted here
A notice of this Chronicle is in Hardy III 361

msItem.head: Walter of Henley, Hosebandrie. Husbandry
Hosebondrie of Walter of Henley, and the anonymous Husbandry

head.title: Advice from a father to his son on the management and improvement of his estate

ab.quote: This treatise contains a succinct account of the mode of husbandry and rural economy of the times: it appears to have been written in the reign of Edward III

msItem.incipit: Le pere dist a sun fiz. beau fiz viuet sagement
msItem.explicit: viii Rousches dun galon de mel
msItem.ab: This is almost certainly the copy used by William Lambarde in his note-book of 1571, now Brit. Mus. Add. 20709, under the title Du gaignage des terres. See the edition by Dr W. Cunningham and E. Lamond (Royal Historical Society 1890), pp. xxxiii, xxxviii. Corrected by Dr Cunningham in Transactions Royal Historical Society IX 1895, p. 215
On weights and measures, in Latin. Prices of bread, and of colours

msItem.incipit: A mundi creacione usque ad Romam urbem conditam
msItem.ab: (on the Pope and Cardinals)

Distich on lower margin: Roma capit marcas bursas exhaurit et archas
Ut tibi tu parcas fuge papas et patriarchas
Natus est Christus in Betlehem nocte diei dominice qui primus et summus pontifex
List follows

head.title: The usage and customs of the community of Kent
Les usages et les coustumes les queus la comunaute de Kent clayment aver en gavelikende et en gens gavelikendyes

msItem.incipit: Ces sunt les usages e les costumes les queus la comunaute de kent clayment auer ... dunt il est dit en Kentoys þe vader to þe boghe and þe sone to þe loghe
msItem.explicit: ke furent deuant le conqueste e en le conqueste e totes houres dekes en ca
msItem.ab: Forms of oaths
msItem.incipit: Cancia est prouincia in anglia iuxta oceanum
msItem.explicit: alia habet commoda vite mortalium necessaria que recitari per singula longum esset

msItem.incipit: Ceo est la marechausie de chiuals. Peleyn deit cure treys aunz oue sa mere
msItem.explicit: de vin blanc a beure chaud kant il auerad ankes erre
bibat illam aquam qui portauit rumores et sic recedat

head.title: The monasteries of England and their founders
De monasteriis in Anglia et eorum fundatoribus

msItem.incipit: In Pago Cantuar. edificauit Edelbertus monasteria Sancti Augustini
msItem.ab: The last is a note on Etheldreda: Velata erat apud eli cum sorore sua
In another hand: a table in six columns, Reges, Anni, Archiepiscopi, Anni, Abbates, Anni

From Ethelbert to Edward II in the original hand. Archbishops to Johannes frater minor (Peckham) and Robertus. Abbots to Radulphus (Bourn). Continued by various hands to Edward IV, King, Thomas Bowseyr, Archbishop, William Sellyng, Abbot
msItem.incipit: Stante obsessione contra Lucam usque ad terminum .xxx. dierum
msItem.explicit: et Regem Cicilie fredericum suum constituens vicarium domino reddidit spiritum
msItem.ab: pp. 173-176 blank

msItem.incipit: Ierusalem, Sepulcrum domini. Ista ecclesia sita est in decliuo montis syon
msItem.explicit: sex miliaria a mari galilee vel Tiberiadis
msItem.incipit: Acon distat a nazareȝ vii miliaria etc.

head.title: Customary and excerpt from the privileges of the monastery of St Augustine's, Canterbury
Custumale et excerpta ex privilegiis monasterii Sancti Augustini

msItem.ab: List of dues from manors: Minster etc.
Distribucio cere (Candlemas). Distribucio argenti in festo Sancti Augustini
Longitudo stragule
List of priuilegia
Knights' fees
Temporalia of the Archbishop, Abbot, Prior etc.
Custumare: of bread etc.: a slip inserted giving particulars about bread
Dues of various officers
double columns, alphabetical: crossed out
msItem.rubric: De confirmacione cartarum. et visu franci pleggii
msItem.explicit: apud douor. xxii die maii anno regni nostri vito
par le serment qe wus auet fet
msItem.ab: Notes in various hands, xiv and xv
Forma treugarum inter Regem Anglie et Robertum de Brus (1323)
Unfinished
Privileges claimed by the Abbot of St Augustine's
Interpretacio verborum. Saka. Idem est quod placitum etc.
The Latin ends with Forstalles. Then in French: Sokne cest asauer sute de vos hommes ... Ferdfaire cest seruice daler en host
Notes of cent. xvi
In 1529. Oct. 31. A robbery of plate
In 1531. 3 Id. Apr. (and other dates). Removal of precious metals from shrines of Saints Augustine, Jambert, Mildred etc. and other spoliations
In 1535 further spoliation
On p. 212: suuerderi καὶ φιλῶν
pp. 213-215 blank
Accounts De Bosc. superius apud Tenterdenne 24 Edwardi III and other similar accounts
Paragraph per viam eleccionis capituli cum expediat via mixta scrutinii et compromissi
Compromisarii traxerunt se ad angulum australem capituli quorum duo, viz. fratres Thomas Ikham et Henricus Tilmanstone etc.
List of monks and their votes (which are for William Thorne, Thomas Ikham, Michael Pecham: the last was eventually elected Abbot)
Extractus de quadam tabula in ecclesia conuentuali Colcestre, giving dates of foundation of Glastonbury, Westminster (A.D. 169), St Augustine's, St Alban's
Application from Richard Cokman, custos in St Nicholas Church at Dover, to Francis, Cardinal of the Four Crowned, for an indulgence for an altar of the Virgin and St John of Bridlington
The Cardinal seems to be Francesco Uguccione, Archbishop of Bordeaux, d. 1412
Epitaph of Archbishop Chicheley, Pauper eram natus etc.
Receipt for gout, in French (xiv)
Note of date of canonization of St Thomas of Hereford (1320, 14 kal. Mai)
Epitaph of Peter Comestor (xvi)
p. 222 covered with paper
